person.name: Niall Wingham
person.title: Apsis Alum
person.bio:
Niall is a cheerful curmudgeon and likes reading language and
protocol specifications. He lives with his professorial wife
and pint-sized daughter in Toronto, and is by default the head
of the Canadian branch of Apsis. When he grows up he wants to
be a farmer, or maybe a ballet dancer, or no, wait, a sailor!

posts.author: niall
posts.title: Parsing JSON with Types (Part 1)
posts.excerpt: I like to have well-defined models of my application data, especially at service boundaries. I usually also define types in my application code to reflect these models. When data are sent from a service, their values are serialized and their types are mapped onto the type system of the…
posts.desc: I like to have well-defined models of my application data, especially at service boundaries.  I usually also define types in my application code to reflect these models. posts.author: niall
posts.title: Asynchronous Action Creators in Redux
posts.excerpt: Improving the logic-to-boilerplate ratio of asynchronous action definitions.
posts.desc: Improving the logic-to-boilerplate ratio of asynchronous action definitions.

posts.author: niall
posts.title: Work & Passion
posts.excerpt: Hi, I’m Niall. I’m the third hire (fifth including founders) at Apsis. The first thing you ought to know about me is that I disdain work.
posts.desc: Hi, I'm Niall.  I'm the third hire (fifth including founders) at Apsis. The first thing you ought to know about me is that I disdain work.
